text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
New Years!

Just kidding! OK, but it is New Years Eve! And,
as you can tell we are in a new kitchen.

I am so excited, because there’s a ton of
space to bake, I love this kitchen,
it even has a double oven!

And, this year we’re gonna be making something
I got so many requests for, last

year I made champagne cupcakes, and this year
people were asking for something

that was non-alcoholic. So, we are gonna be
making sparkling apple cider

YouTube Cupcakes. And they’re gonna be super
blingy for the new year!
Let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: 3 cups
of flour, 1-1/2 cups of brown sugar,

4 eggs, 2 sh-ticks of butter which equals 1
cup, 1 teaspoon of salt,

2 teaspoons of baking powder, 1-1/2 tablespoons
of vanilla extract, and

a cup of sh-parkling apple cider! And you’ll
need 2 mixing bowls and a whisk.
Alright, let’s put it together!

First thing that you’re gonna do is take
one of your big mixing bowls and we’re

gonna mix in all of our dry ingredients, so
you’re gonna take your flour,
mix it in. Doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!
And you’re gonna take salt, toss it in there.
And you’re gonna take baking powder.
Soda… Powder… Yes.

Then you’re gonna take a whisk and mwix
it all together… Whiskm… Whisk it all together.
I can talk today!

Alright, once that’s mixed we’re just
gonna set this off to the side, then, in

you other big mixing bowl. Let me open…
Wait, OK I locked it, I’m still figuring

this thing out. You can use a hand mixer,
that’s totally fine, but I’m

just using the KitchenAid. You are gonna mix
in your brown sugar, you 2 sh-ticks

of butter, these are room temperature, I let
them sit out so they’re a little bit
soft, it’s just perfect.

Once your butter and sugar are in the kitchenmaid,
what you’re gonna do is just

push this down, and you’re gonna mix everything
together until it’s nice
and creamy….
On a low speed!

Once you’re mixture’s done it will be
really creamy, that’s what it’s supposed to

look like, now… Uh, uh. Lock that back in
place.

Now you’re gonna add 4 eggs, you’re just
gonna add them 1 at a time, so add 1

and then mix, and then another one, and then
mix.
Let’s get crackin!

Once you’ve beaten in your eggs you’re
gonna add 1-1/2 tablespoons of vanilla extract.

Now for the sparkling apple cider, we’re
gonna pour 1 cup. I’m just gonna

measure it out but first I gotta open this,
hopefully it will be easier than

the champagne bottle! I believe these are
a twist off aren’t they?
Oooooung, oh! That’s not a twist off!
Got 1 of these, this is my backup.
Ohp! Did it? Oh!
Uh-oh! OK.

No, no, no! No, no, no, no, no, no, no! No,
no! Oh no!
Oh god, Happy New Years!

Taste test! OK, it’s good! Alright, now
we’re just gonna pour a cup,
that’s about a cup!

Now what you’re gonna do is add your 2 ingredients
alternating. So you’re gonna

add a little flour, mix it up, and then a
little cider and mix it up!

Then a little flour, then mix it up, then
a little cider, and mix it up!

All I know is you want to start with your
flour, and end with your flour!

Our batter is all ready, that’s what it
looks like all mixed up.

It smells so good! Alright, now you’re just
gonna take a cupcake tray,

I have lined them with these little paper
liners, and now you’re gonna take

a tablespoon, this is my favorite way to do
it. And you’re just gonna scoop

2 tablespoons of batter into each cupcake
tray.

Once you’ve filled all your cupcake trays
you’re just gonna heat your oven to 350 and
you’re gonna bake these for 20 minutes.

Keep your eye on them, and as soon as they
start to turn a
little golden brown, they are done!
Oh yeah, double oven!

While your cupcakes are baking we are gonna
make some decorrrrrations!

You’re gonna take red and white melted chocolates,
I melted both of these,

put them in a plastic bag and put some number
3 tips at the top.

And what we’ve got going on here is a candy
mold, these are like chocolate molds.

You can find these online, or at a local baking
store, I got this one from

Gloria’s. And I printed off little YouTube
logos, on just a piece of paper,

and something that would fit right underneath
it that kind of lined up.

So what you’re gonna do is just put this
down, and then you're gonna take your plastic

candy mold and put it right on top so it kind
of gives you an idea of the sizing.

And I’m gonna take my red chocolate and
fill in the space.

Once you’re done making these red rectangles,
you’re just gonna pop this in the

freezer for about 5 minutes. Then you’re
gonna take ‘em out and fill them all in

with white chocolate. And then put it back
in the freezer for 10 minutes.

Once your chocolates have chilled in the freezer,
you’re gonna take them out

and I’m just popping them on top of this
cookie sheet.

Hopefully they’ll pop right out, put some
pressure on ‘em, there we go! Perfect!
Ah, they’re so cute!

They’ll look like that, and it’s OK if
they’re uneven on the bottom because

you won’t see it, we’re gonna put it on
top of the frosting.

But what you are gonna see is we are going
to write YouTube on the front.

We’re gonna use decorative icing, I’m
using a Wilton Brand, I just found these

at the grocery store, and I just put a fancy
tip on the top.
We’ve got black frosting and white frosting.

And, I’m gonna start with the black, and
we’re gonna write “You”

After you’re done making your YouTube logo
decorations, you’re gonna take

your cupcakes out of the oven, make sure they’ve
had plenty of time to cool, and

now we are going to frost them, I’m just
using a vanilla whipped frosting, it’s

really, really light, and we’re just gonna
frost every cupcake.
I’m just doing 6 for an example.

We’re gonna bling them with these 2 things,
we have white, like, sugar sparkles

from Wilton, and then this is called cake
dust.
I’m going crazy with it!
Gosh, I’m making it, it looks like snow.

I make it snow! I make it snow! I make it
snow!
I’ll just put these on now!

Oh this, it feels like hail, so this would
be like hailing.

I make it hail, I make it hail, I make it
hail!

Now that you’ve got all the sprinkles on
top, what I’m gonna do is,

I’ve got these extra red cupcake liners,
I got them in the multipack from Target.

And I’m just gonna put them around each
cupcake,
and then stick the YouTube logos on top!
Ta-daaa!

Here are our Apple Sparkling Cider YouTube
Cupcakes, thanks you guys

for suggesting it, I really wanted to do a
non-alcoholic, like, New Year

Recipe and I finally got to do it, so thank
you guys!

And, don’t forget to follow me on Facebook,
Tumblr and Twitter, because I love

to post pictures of all the Nerdy Nummies
creations, and, if you ever make

these, send me pictures on Facebook and Twitter
because I love to post them.

AND! If you have any other suggestions for
any other Nerdy Nummies, let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!

Alright, thanks you guys and Happy Nerdy New
Year!
Bye-Bye!
